intro: Homochaete dinteriana, commonly known as the Dinter's homochaete, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Homochaete dinteriana is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
